messageBody:
On Wed, Sep 2, 2009 at 9:29 PM, David Saff <david@...> wrote:

> Thanks for the feedback! Â Glad the method-level rules are working out for you.

In my case, I was able to extend ExternalResource to provide a
lightweight HTTP server test harness (using the HTTP server API in
Java 6) that could provide specific responses tailored for each
particular test. I wrote all about it in:

http://alistairisrael.wordpress.com/2009/09/03/functional-http-testing-revisited-using-junit-interceptors/

Conceptually, though, it might be desirable to have the HTTP server
start up only once before all the test methods, then each method
simply registers its own handler (which can be 'deregistered'
automatically to preserve test independence). Hence my query.


> We're hearing loud and clear, from you and others, that class-level
> rules are valuable, so they're in the future plans.

Thanks. Will look forward to hearing more about this and seeing them in > 4.7

- alistair
